item.title: Kurt add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Kurt add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "All human beings should try to learn before they die what they are running from, and to, and why." -- James Thurber

item.title: Kurt add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "Quick, name some towns in New Jersey" -- James Thurber

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Lynne Truss
item.description: "Thurber was asked by a correspondent: "Why did you have a comma in the sentence, 'After dinner, the men went into the living-room'?" And his answer was probably one of the loveliest things ever said about punctuation. "This particular comma," Thurber explained, "was Ross's way of giving the men time to push back their chairs and stand up." -- Lynne Truss

item.title: Kurt add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "It is better to have loafed and lost than never to have loafed at all." -- James Thurber

item.title: Kurt add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "I used to wake up at 4 A.M. and start sneezing, sometimes for five hours. I tried to find out what sort of allergy I had but finally came to the conclusion that it must be an allergy to consciousness." -- James Thurber

item.title: Kurt add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "I am not a cat man, but a dog man, and all felines can tell this at a glance - a sharp, vindictive glance. " -- James Thurber

item.title: Kurt add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "If I have any beliefs about immortality, it is that certain dogs I have known will go to heaven, and very, very few persons. " -- James Thurber

item.title: Kurt add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "The wit makes fun of other persons; the satirist makes fun of the world; the humorist makes fun of himself." -- James Thurber

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "I hate Disneyland. It primes our kids for Las Vegas." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "Your old home town's so far away, but inside your head there's a record that's playing, a song called 'Hold On" -- Tom Waits

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "There ain't no devil, only God when he's drunk." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "The big print giveth and the small print taketh away. " -- Tom Waits

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "A gentleman is someone who can play the accordion, but doesn't." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "I like beautiful melodies telling me terrible things." -- Tom Waits

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Kurt add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't see from the center." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Norman Lewis
item.description: "I am looking for the people who have always been there, and belong to the places they live. The others I do not wish to see." -- Norman Lewis

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Bohumil Hrabal
item.description: "I pop a beautiful sentence into my mouth and suck it like a fruit drop." -- Bohumil Hrabal

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Josephine Winslow Johnson
item.description: "The earth was overwhelmed with beauty and indifferent to it, and I went with a heart ready to crack for its unbearable loveliness." -- Josephine Winslow Johnson
